intro: Decaspermum confinis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants with milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow to orange. Its flowers are typically followed by follicles that release seeds with silky hairs for wind dispersal. The plant is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
